item.title: Lynette add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Simply because we were licked a hundred years before we started is no reason for us not to try to win." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Lynette add a quote by dave eggers
item.description: "We are unusual and tragic and alive." -- dave eggers

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family. " -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "Life is an awful, ugly place to not have a best friend." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Lynette add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "The thing about a hero, is even when it doesn't look like there's a light at the end of the tunnel, he's going to keep digging, he's going to keep trying to do right and make up for what's gone before, just because that's who he is." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Rachel Cohn
item.description: "It's a total lie to say there's only one person you're going to be with for the rest of your life. If you're lucky - and if you try really hard - there will always be more than one. " -- Rachel Cohn

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "There's nothing wrong with reading a book you love over and over. When you do, the words get inside you, become a part of you, in a way that words in a book you've read only once can't." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "Some things don't last forever, but some things do. Like a good song, or a good book, or a good memory you can take out and unfold in your darkest times, pressing down on the corners and peering in close, hoping you still recognize the person you see there." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "There is only one page left to write on. I will fill it with words of only one syllable. I love. I have loved. I will love." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Megan McCafferty
item.description:
"I thought Marcus was going to be in my life forever. Then I thought I was wrong. Now he’s back. But this time I know what’s certain: Marcus will be gone again, and back again and again and again because nothing is permanent. Especially people. Strangers become friends. Friends become lovers. Lovers become strangers. Strangers become friends once more, and over and over. Tomorrow, next week, fifty years from now, I know I’ll get another one-word postcard from Marcus, because this one doesn’t have a period signifying the end of the sentence.
Or the end of anything at all." -- Megan McCafferty

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of. " -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Lynette add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Mr. Moony presents his compliments to Professor Snape, and begs him to keep his abnormally large nose out of other people's business. Mr. Prongs agrees with Mr. Moony, and would like to add that Professor Snape is an ugly git. Mr. Padfoot would like to register his astonishment that an idiot like that ever became a professor. Mr. Wormtail bids Professor Snape good day, and advises him to wash his hair, the slimeball." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Jacqueline Carey
item.description: "It's the same questions we ask of our existence, and the answer is always the same. The mystery lies not in the question nor the answer, but in the asking and answering themselves, over and over again, and the end is engendered in the beginning. " -- Jacqueline Carey

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Rachel Cohn
item.description: "I Wanna Hold Your Hand.’ First single. Fucking brilliant. Perhaps the most fucking brilliant song ever written. Because they nailed it. That’s what everyone wants. Not 24-7 hot wet sex. Not a marriage that lasts a hundred years. Not a Porsche or a blow job or a million-dollar crib. No. They wanna hold your hand. They have a feeling that they can’t hide." -- Rachel Cohn

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "You're in America now," I said. "Our idea of diplomacy is showing up with a gun in one hand and a sandwich in the other and asking which you'd prefer." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "You can't make any one person your world. The trick is to take what each can give you and build a world from it." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Erich Segal
item.description: "Quiet heroism or youthful idealism, or both? What do we know? That life without heroism and idealism is not worth living - or that either can be fatal?" -- Erich Segal

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Eric Segal
item.description: "What can you say about a twenty-five year old girl who died? That she was beautiful and brilliant. That she loved Mozart and Bach. The Beatles. And me." -- Eric Segal

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Junot Diaz
item.description:
"You see, in my view a writer is a writer not because she writes well and easily, because she has amazing talent, because everything she does is golden. In my view a writer is a writer because even when there is no hope, even when nothing you do shows any sign of promise, you keep writing anyway."
[<i>Becoming a Writer/ The List</i>, O Magazine, November 2009]" -- Junot Diaz

item.title: Lynette add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Lynette add a quote by J.K. Rowling
Lynette add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Give her hell from us, Peeves." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lynette add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It was, he thought, the difference between being dragged into the arena to face a battle to the death and walking into the arena with your head held high. Some people, perhaps, would say that there was little to choose between the two ways, but Dumbledore knew - and so do I, thought Harry, with a rush of fierce pride, and so did my parents - that there was all the difference in the world." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lynette add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "We're all human, aren't we? Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Jay McInerney
item.description: "The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families." -- Jay McInerney

item.title: Lynette add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Let us step into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lynette add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I solemnly swear that I am up to no good." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lynette add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Two roads diverged in a wood, and I took the road less traveled by and they CANCELLED MY FRIKKIN' SHOW. I totally shoulda took the road that had all those people on it. Damn." -- Joss Whedon
